source_sentence: 爾時最勝菩薩白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the most excellent bodhisattva said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若有眾生欲使諸法出生，則無有道成等正覺，何況於泥洹欲成道乎？
translation: If there are sentient beings who want to cause all dharmas to arise, then there would be no path to achieve perfect enlightenment, let alone nirvāṇa in which they want to achieve the path.

source_sentence: 此則不然。
translation: That's not the case.

source_sentence: 泥洹無姓亦無名號，云何欲於空中求空？
translation: Nirvana has neither a family name nor a title, so how could it want to pursue emptiness in the sky?

source_sentence: 泥洹無一，況當欲求諸法之數？
translation: How could one want to investigate the number of dharmas when nirvāṇa is not one?

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此七百比丘於如來所，剃除鬚髮服三法衣，手執應器淨修梵行，方便退轉在凡夫地，欲求泥洹窠窟處所，猶如麻油醍醐酪酥，油則遍周酥則凝住。
translation: These 700 monks shaved off their hair and put on the three dharma robes, held suitable utensils in their hands, purified their religious practice, and conveniently retreated to the worldling stage, where they wanted to pursue the nirvāṇa sphere of existence like sesame oil, ghee, butter, and curd, which then thoroughly surrounds the butter and solidifies it.

source_sentence: 生死泥洹亦復如是，至竟泥洹無諸法相，泥洹大道亦無崖底。
translation: So it is with the nirvāṇa of birth-and-death, until the final nirvāṇa has no characteristics of things, and the nirvāṇa path has no cliff bottom.

source_sentence: 群惑之人執迷來久，却謂泥洹有生滅著斷，唯有修行之人執行正見，不見諸法有起有滅，不見諸法有受有捨。」
translation: While people with numerous mental disturbances have long held to delusion and yet claim that nirvāṇa has birth and cessation, only those who practice carry out the right view and don't see that dharmas have arising and cessation or that dharmas have sensation and equanimity."

source_sentence: 爾時，最勝菩薩前白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, the most excellent bodhisattva went forward and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此七百比丘即聞法教各捨馳散，當復經歷幾時乃得度脫，永離生死不在邪見？」
translation: How long will these 700 monks who have heard the teaching of the Dharma each abandon and scatter go through before they are liberated and become permanently free of birth-and-death and not hold to wrong views?"

source_sentence: 佛告最勝：「汝欲知者，諦聽諦聽善思念之，吾當與汝蠲除狐疑。」
translation: The Buddha told Bhadrapāla, "If you want to know, listen closely and consider it well, and I will relieve you of any misgivings."

source_sentence: 對曰：「如是。

source_sentence: 佛言：「恒沙劫過乃一佛出，如是經歷七十二億恒沙劫數，猶不得度。
translation: The Buddha said, "After an eon of sands, only one Buddha emerges, and after experiencing 7.2 billion eons of sands like this, it's still not possible to cross over.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 億千萬劫佛乃出世，值佛甚難經難得聞，今日如來、至真、等正覺，在大眾中敷演道教，說無生滅泥洹之法；於正法中生邪見心，所生之處，恒在邪見不在正道。
translation: Today, the Tathāgata, the supreme truth, and the perfectly enlightened one preach the path among the masses and teach the nirvāṇa dharma of nonarising and cessation; when wrong views arise in the midst of the right Dharma, the places they arise are always in wrong views and not in the right path.

source_sentence: 猶如士夫勇猛多力，無方伎術無不貫練，六藝備具，天文地理星宿災怪皆悉開通。
translation: He's like a man of great courage and strength who has no skill in any area, is fully equipped with the six arts, and has an understanding of astronomy, geography, stars, and calamities.

source_sentence: 然此力士恒畏虛空，竊自設計，馳趣四方投無空界，在在處處恒見虛空。
translation: Still, this strong man is always afraid of space, so he secretly devises his own course, rushes in all directions, throws himself into the realm of no space, and always sees space everywhere.

source_sentence: 此諸比丘亦復如是，正使經歷百千萬劫，欲於空中立泥洹名，此事不然。
translation: This monk is likewise, for even though he's gone through a hundred million eons, he wants to establish the name nirvāṇa in the sky, but this is not the case.

source_sentence: 所至到處不了空性，願求於道終不可果。
translation: They don't understand the nature of emptiness everywhere they go, and their desire to pursue the path is never realized.

source_sentence: 如復有人欲求於空，在在處處空恒在前，亦不演說此空彼空有若干相，不見從空往來有所成辦，斯乃解知泥洹之要。
translation: If another person wants to pursue emptiness but always has emptiness in front of them everywhere, doesn't explain how this emptiness or that emptiness has various aspects, and doesn't see anything accomplished from emptiness going forward, then they understand the essentials of nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 彼諸比丘前世習邪至今不寤，欲求泥洹無為大道，猶尚不識名號姓字，豈能分別泥洹道乎？
translation: Those monks who had cultivated wrong habits in a previous life and still haven't awakened from them want to pursue the nirvāṇa and the path of nothingness, but still don't recognize names and surnames, how could they discern the nirvāṇa path?

source_sentence: 終日周旋求於滅度，唐勞其功而不可獲。
translation: He spends his whole life circling around seeking to extinguish it, but his efforts are unsuccessful.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 泥洹假號如幻如化，空無所有假名為空，假號虛詐愚人所傳，非賢聖法律之所讚歎。」
translation: The false name of nirvāṇa is illusory and transformation-like, and emptiness has no substance and is nominally called emptiness; false names are fraudulently transmitted by fools and not praised by good and noble men of the Dharma."

source_sentence: 爾時復有立行比丘七百餘人，即於座上諸塵垢盡得法眼淨，三達六通無所罣礙，了佛無生亦不起滅，不以過去諸法求於泥洹，無數恒沙諸佛過去所說教誡智慧辯才悉無若干，從凡夫起乃至無學，演說道教無有差違，不見眾生流浪生死，不見泥洹當有起滅。
translation: At the time, there were another 700 or so ascending monks who, while on their seats, had exhausted the defilements and attained purification of the Dharma eye, had the three comprehensions and six supernormal powers without any obstructions, realized that buddhas don't arise and don't cease, didn't seek nirvāṇa based on past teachings, and had no variation in the wisdom and eloquence of countless buddhas who had taught and instructed in the past, starting from worldlings up to the post-learner, taught the way without any discrepancies, didn't see sentient beings wandering through birth and death, and didn't see nirvāṇa that would arise or cease.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 一切諸法悉空如空，不見諸佛所出窠窟。
translation: All dharmas are empty like space, and they don't see the caves from which the buddhas emerge.

source_sentence: 爾時座上六百優婆塞、三百優婆夷，皆得盡信之行。
translation: At that point, the 600 laymen and 300 laywomen on the throne all attained the practice of complete faith.

source_sentence: 無數天與世人皆發無上正真道意。
translation: Countless gods and humans arouse the intention for the unsurpassed true path.

source_sentence: 爾時長老舍利弗告五百比丘曰：「汝等諸人各獲通慧必本願耶？」
translation: It was then that the elder Śāriputra addressed the five hundred monks, "Have you each attained penetrating insight and must have vowed in the past?"

source_sentence: 諸比丘言：「尊者舍利弗！
translation: The monks said, "Venerable Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 曩昔所願今日已獲，所作已辦更不受有。」
translation: Today, I've obtained what I wished in the past, and after accomplishing it, I won't be subject to another existence."

source_sentence: 舍利弗言：「善所問者知所趣乎？」
translation: Śāriputra said, "Does he who well asks know what he's headed for?"

source_sentence: 諸比丘言：「盡諸結縛更不染有，不愛生死不著泥洹，泥洹無為行合空性，無結縛盡亦不見盡，是謂泥洹。」
translation: The monks said, "This is called nirvāṇa when the bonds are ended, being undefiled by existence, not craving birth-and-death, not being attached to nirvāṇa, nirvāṇa when the practice of noncontamination coincides with emptiness, and nirvāṇa when the bonds are ended and not seen to be ended."

source_sentence: 爾時舍利弗讚彼比丘曰：「善哉善哉！
translation: It was then that Śāriputra praised that monk, "Good, good!

source_sentence: 族姓子，真解空性甚深之義。
translation: Sons of great clans really understand the profound meaning of emptiness.

source_sentence: 今有幾賢住於福地？」
translation: How many good men are there today who live in a blessed place?"

source_sentence: 諸比丘曰：「尊者舍利弗即是福田如來所稱，施行佛事未曾唐捐，我等諸人，於十六分未獲其一。」
translation: The monks said, "Venerable Śāriputra is a field of merit as the Tathāgata calls it, performing Buddha-works that have never been spared, and we have not yet attained even one of the 16 parts."

source_sentence: 舍利弗言：「汝五百人，悉是彼此解脫之士，亦是福田。」
translation: Śāriputra said, "All 500 of you are men of mutual liberation, and you are fields of merit."

source_sentence: 諸比丘曰：「如來聖慧性自清淨，於諸法界無所染著。」
translation: The monks said, "The nature of the Tathāgata's noble wisdom is naturally pure, and there's no defiled attachment to the Dharma realm."

source_sentence: 是時最勝菩薩前白佛言：「世有幾賢必報施恩？」
translation: The most excellent bodhisattva then went forward and said to the Buddha, "How many good men in the world would surely repay the kindness given to them?"

source_sentence: 佛告最勝：「不著世法能報施恩。」
translation: The Buddha told Most Excellent, "He doesn't attach to worldly dharmas to be able to repay kindnesses given."

source_sentence: 又問：「復有幾賢於施清淨？」
translation: He also asked, "How many more good men are there who purify their giving?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「不受諸法乃謂清淨。」
translation: He answered, "It's considered pure not to accept any dharmas."

source_sentence: 又問：「何者是施福田？」
translation: Again, he asked, "What's a field of merit that's given?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「忘佛道法乃謂福田。」
translation: He answered, "Forgetting the Buddha's way and teaching is called a field of merit."

source_sentence: 又問：「復有幾賢於眾生種為善知識指授善惡？」
translation: Again, he asked, "How many more good men are there who are good teachers of the seeds of sentient beings who instruct good and evil?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「不捨一切眾生之類，是謂善知識。」
translation: He answered, "This is called a good teacher who doesn't abandon all types of sentient beings."

source_sentence: 又問：「世有幾賢能報佛恩？」
translation: Again, he asked, "How many good men are there in the world who can repay the Buddha's kindness?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「獲四無畏不斷佛種。」
translation: He answered, "Attain the four fearlessnesses and never stop being a buddha-seed."

source_sentence: 又問：「世有幾賢能供養如來？」
translation: Again, he asked, "How many good men are there in the world who can make offerings to the Tathāgata?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「億萬劫行於中不惑，是謂供養。」
translation: He answered, "A billion eons of practice in which one isn't confused is called making offerings."

source_sentence: 又問：「世有幾賢能護佛藏？」
translation: Again, he asked, "How many good men are there in the world who can protect the Buddha's treasury?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「盡其形壽不毀佛戒。」
translation: They replied, "They will live their whole lives without violating the Buddha's precepts."

source_sentence: 又問：「復有幾賢能興恭敬？」
translation: Again, he asked, "How many more good men are there who can inspire respect?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「守護諸根能閉六情。」
translation: He answered, "Guarding the faculties can shut off the six emotions."

source_sentence: 又問：「何者世間名大珍寶？」
translation: Again, he asked, "What's called a great treasure in the world?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「成就七寶者。」
translation: They replied, "They've accomplished the seven treasures."

source_sentence: 又問：「云何解知足行？」
translation: Again, he asked, "How do you understand the practice of knowing and being satisfied?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「修於第一無上慧義。」
translation: He answered, "Cultivate the supreme meaning of wisdom."

source_sentence: 又曰：「云何於世少欲？」
translation: He also said, "How can you have few desires in the world?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「不願求於世。」
translation: He answered, "I don't want to seek the world."

source_sentence: 又問：「云何解世無著？」
translation: Again, he asked, "How does one understand that the world is unattached?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「斷諸結縛無復五蓋。」
translation: They replied, "They cut the bonds and don't have the five hindrances again."

source_sentence: 又問：「世誰快樂無復眾苦？」
translation: Again, he asked, "Who in the world is happy and has no more suffering?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「無所係屬故謂為樂。」
translation: He answered, "It's called happiness because it has no dependents."

source_sentence: 又問：「云何無所係屬？」
translation: Again, he asked, "How is it that there's nothing to be affiliated with?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「解知五陰十八本持空寂無為。」
translation: He answered, "He understands that the five aggregates and the 18 primordial aspects are empty, quiescent, and noncontrived."

source_sentence: 又問：「誰有此難？」
translation: Again, he asked, "Who has this difficulty?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「外捨六塵內捨六情。」
translation: He answered, "Let go of the six external defilements and let go of the six internal emotions."

source_sentence: 又問：「誰度此岸得至彼岸？」
translation: Again, he asked, "Who crosses this shore and reaches the other shore?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「立根得力成道者也。」
translation: He answered, "It's the one who establishes the faculties and obtains the strength to achieve the path."

source_sentence: 又問：「云何菩薩施心不斷？」
translation: Again, he asked, "How does a bodhisattva's mind not stop giving?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「消除三想不興塵勞。」
translation: He answered, "Eliminating the three conceptions doesn't create dust and trouble."

source_sentence: 又問：「云何持戒而不缺漏？」
translation: Again, he asked, "How do you observe the precepts without running short of them?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「道心堅固不捨弘誓。」
translation: He answered, "The mind of the Way is resolute, and it doesn't abandon the great vow."

source_sentence: 「云何行忍遭對不懼？」
translation: "How does practicing forbearance meet with confrontation and not fear?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「解心空寂不起恚本。」
translation: He answered, "He understands that the mind is empty and quiescent, and the base of anger doesn't arise."

source_sentence: 「云何菩薩修於精進？」
translation: "How do bodhisattvas cultivate exertion?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「心之所念無有端緒。」
translation: He answered, "There's no beginning to what the mind is thinking."

source_sentence: 又問：「云何禪定意不戲損？」
translation: Again, he asked, "How is meditation mindfulness not impaired by play?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「心定永寂不受外塵。」
translation: He answered, "The mind is calm and permanent, and it doesn't accept external objects."

source_sentence: 「云何慧業演暢諸法？」
translation: "How does the activity of wisdom develop and spread the teachings?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「分別義趣不捨道心。」
translation: He answered, "They discern the aim of the meaning and don't abandon the mind of the path."

source_sentence: 又問：「云何菩薩修行慈心不捨道根？」
translation: Again, he asked, "How do bodhisattvas cultivate a compassionate mind and not abandon the root of the path?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「不捨眾生見有度者。」
translation: They replied, "They don't abandon sentient beings and see those who have crossed over."

source_sentence: 又問：「云何菩薩行於悲心？」
translation: Again, he asked, "How do bodhisattvas practice the mind of compassion?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「思惟諸法而不退轉。」
translation: He answered, "He contemplates the teachings and doesn't falter."

source_sentence: 又問：「云何菩薩喜意不斷得至滅度？」
translation: Again, he asked, "How does a bodhisattva's joyful intent not stop until he attains extinction?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「不興我想計有吾我。」
translation: They replied, "They don't conceptualize self and think there's a self."

source_sentence: 又問：「云何菩薩護心不斷？」
translation: Again, he asked, "How do bodhisattvas guard their minds without stopping?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「守護道根畢至成佛，於其中間不興餘想。」
translation: He answered, "After guarding the faculty of the path until he becomes a buddha, he doesn't give rise to any other thoughts in between."

source_sentence: 又問：「云何菩薩立於信根？」
translation: Again, he asked, "How does a bodhisattva establish the faculty of faith?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「超越外法不與邪俱。」
translation: They replied, "They transcend external phenomena and don't associate with evil."

source_sentence: 又問：「云何解空而無猶豫？」
translation: Again, he asked, "How do you understand emptiness and have no hesitation?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「解道非道道無根源。
translation: He answered, "The path of understanding is not the path; the path has no root.

source_sentence: 是謂菩薩摩訶薩所應行業。」
translation: This is called the trade to which a bodhisattva-mahāsattva should be devoted."

source_sentence: 四梵堂品第三十一
translation: Chapter 31 of the Four Brahma Halls

source_sentence: 爾時濡首童真，內心自念：「云何菩薩摩訶薩，於身口意淨修梵行，周遍四荒往度眾生，從一佛國至一佛國，未曾捨離眾生？
translation: It was then that Mañjuśrī thought to himself, "How does a bodhisattva-mahāsattva purify the religious practice of body, speech, and thought, travel throughout the four wildernesses to deliver sentient beings, and go from one Buddha-land to another without ever abandoning sentient beings?

source_sentence: 云何菩薩進成佛業，不失菩薩所行之定？」
translation: How does a bodhisattva advance to buddhahood without losing the concentration that the bodhisattva practices?"

source_sentence: 佛知其意，即告之曰：「如是如是，如汝所言。
translation: Knowing what he meant, the Buddha told him, "So it is, so it is, just as you say.

source_sentence: 菩薩行本其類不同，吾今與汝敷演其義。
translation: Bodhisattvas have different kinds of roots of practice, and now I'm going to explain their meaning to you.

source_sentence: 諦聽諦聽！
translation: Listen closely, listen closely!

source_sentence: 善思念之。」
translation: Consider it well."

source_sentence: 對曰：「如是。
translation: They replied, "So it is.

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 佛告濡首：「身行清淨不為眾惡，口行至誠不失法性，心念定意恐畏不動，是謂菩薩通慧之本。
translation: The Buddha told Mochu, "To conduct oneself in a pure manner and not be subject to numerous evils, to conduct oneself with sincerity in speech and not lose the nature of the Dharma, and to concentrate one's mind in fear and agitation is the basis of a bodhisattva's penetrating wisdom.

source_sentence: 慈念眾生不著愛欲，恒修不淨惡露之觀，守固其心不處愚闇，是謂菩薩通慧之本。
translation: Being mindful of sentient beings and not clinging to craving, constantly cultivating the contemplation of impurity and exposure to evil, and keeping their minds firmly anchored in ignorance and darkness are the basis of the bodhisattva's penetrating wisdom.

source_sentence: 在眾如野不失威儀，進止行來儀容齊整，未曾違失如來禁戒，是謂菩薩通慧之本。
translation: Being in crowds like a wilderness, not losing their dignity, conducting themselves with neatness of manner, and not violating the Tathāgata's prohibitions is the basis of a bodhisattva's penetrating wisdom.

source_sentence: 於諸佛法悉皆解脫，無欲無為不可思議，聖眾修習永無三乘，是謂菩薩通慧之本。
translation: Being liberated from all the buddha-dharmas, wanting nothing, acting unfathomably, and cultivated by noble people, there are never three vehicles, which is called the basis of the bodhisattva's penetrating wisdom.

source_sentence: 於欲解脫曉了無形，瞋恚解脫癡懈亦然，修九次第不動禪覺，是謂菩薩通慧之本。
translation: Being liberated from desire and fully understanding formlessness, liberated from anger and delusion, and similarly lazy, cultivating the nine stages of immovable meditation and awakening is the basis of the bodhisattva's penetrating wisdom.

source_sentence: 不著欲界求轉輪位，不處色界希望成福，復不思惟無色界道，是謂菩薩通慧之本。
translation: Not clinging to the desire realm in pursuit of the turning wheel stage, not hoping to achieve happiness in the form realm, and not contemplating the path to the formless realm are the bodhisattva's basis of penetrating wisdom.

source_sentence: 復於空無無願無相，無不盡有漏之行，解了諸法如幻如化，是謂菩薩通慧之本。
translation: Also, in emptiness, wishlessness, formlessness, and the absence of unceasing contaminated activity, he understands all things as illusory and transformative, which is called the basis of the bodhisattva's penetrating wisdom.

source_sentence: 或有眾生終不失意，從住至住愛憎意等，是謂菩薩通慧之本。
translation: Perhaps there are sentient beings who never lose their mind, abide from abiding to abiding in craving and hate, and so forth, which is called the basis of the bodhisattva's penetrating wisdom.

source_sentence: 不違過去諸法之本，未來現在亦復如是，於染無染不見染著，是謂菩薩通慧之本。」
translation: Not departing from the source of past dharmas and doing likewise in the future and present, not seeing defiled attachment in defilement and undefiledness is called the source of the bodhisattva's penetrating wisdom."

source_sentence: 梵天請品第三十二
translation: Chapter 32 of the invitation to Brahmā

source_sentence: 爾時最勝菩薩摩訶薩白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the most excellent bodhisattva, Mahāsattva, said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 身行清淨不行惡業，演說言教終不虛妄，心念清淨超越道根，尊今所論四等梵堂，慈悲喜護濟度眾生，一人不度終不忘捨，以慈去婬，以不淨去淨，觀相無形，是謂菩薩通慧之本。
translation: Their physical conduct is pure, they don't engage in bad actions, their speech and teaching are never false, their mindfulness is pure, they transcend the root of the path, the venerable discusses the four halls of Brahmā, they are compassionate, joyful, and protective in helping sentient beings, they never forget their equanimity when one person isn't saved, they abandon lust with kindness, abandon purity with impurity, and observe characteristics without form, which is called the basis of the bodhisattva's penetrating wisdom.

source_sentence: 於諸法本悉得解脫，於三法寶悉得解脫，有為無為有漏無漏，是謂菩薩通慧之本。
translation: Attaining liberation in all the dharma essences and liberation in all the three treasures of the Dharma, which are contaminated and uncontaminated, is called the basis of the bodhisattva's penetrating wisdom.

source_sentence: 已知無欲知之不生，瞋恚無本皆知為空，是謂菩薩通慧之本。
translation: Having known that desire doesn't arise and knowing that anger has no basis is empty, this is called the basis of the bodhisattva's penetrating wisdom.

source_sentence: 行慈不斷，不著欲界色無色界，於諸四禪盡不起想，是謂菩薩通慧之本。
translation: Practicing kindness without stopping, not being attached to the desire realm, the form and formless realms, and not conceiving of the four meditation states as being exhausted is the basis of the bodhisattva's penetrating wisdom.

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩，恒入空無想願，亦不求索諸法之相，或有菩薩發弘誓心，設我成佛國界眾生無三乘道名，然我今日至誠，作佛成等正覺，廣化眾生不以為厭。」
translation: A bodhisattva always enters emptiness without conception and doesn't seek the characteristics of dharmas. Perhaps a bodhisattva makes a great vow to suppose that I become a buddha and that sentient beings in the world don't have the name of the path of the three vehicles, but today I am perfectly sincere, become a buddha, and achieve perfect enlightenment, and I widely transform sentient beings without getting tired of it."

source_sentence: 爾時八千天人立於信地，魔王營從即還本所。
translation: At that point, 8,000 gods and humans stood at the stage of faith, and the Māra King camped behind them and returned to their original home.

source_sentence: 梵天囑累品第三十三
translation: Chapter 33 of the Testament of Brahmā

source_sentence: 佛告無畏梵天及諸大眾諸菩薩等：「吾從無數阿僧祇劫積功累德自致成佛，不染於世八法之累，一切眾生蜎飛蠕動有形之類，染著五陰翫而不捨，是以賢聖不染八法，解知五陰十八本持空無所有，離世八事，利衰毀譽稱譏苦樂。」
translation: The Buddha addressed the fearless Brahmās and the masses of bodhisattvas, "Since I accumulated merit over countless incalculable eons to become a buddha on my own, I haven't been stained by the burden of the eight worldly dharmas, and all sentient beings of the larvae, flying, wriggling, and tangible types are stained by the five aggregates and resorts to them without abandoning them.

source_sentence: 佛復告梵天：「若有善男子善女人，諷誦受持此經典者，魔若魔天不能沮壞。
translation: The Buddha again told the Brahmā gods, "If good sons and good women recite and memorize this sūtra, Māra and Māra Devānām-Indra won't be able to dissuade them.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 諸佛世尊威神所護。
translation: The buddhas are protected by the authority and spirituality of the world-honored ones.

source_sentence: 若有善男子善女人，求於無上正真等正覺，皆由此典而取果證。」
translation: If there are good sons and good women who seek unsurpassed correct, true, and equal enlightenment, they will all attain its realization from this sūtra."

source_sentence: 佛復告梵天：「吾今從劫至百千劫，滿中眾生，皆共稱歎此經典者不能究盡。
translation: The Buddha again told the Brahmadeva, "Now, from one eon to a hundred thousand eons, the multitude of sentient beings who praise this sūtra together can't exhaust it.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 此經名曰『無盡之藏』，非是羅漢辟支所及；一名『最勝菩薩所問』。
translation: This sūtra is called 'the inexhaustible treasury,' which is beyond the reach of the arhats and pratyekbuddhas, and it's called 'the most excellent bodhisattva's question.'

source_sentence: 吾今囑累此經，無令缺漏一字，味身句身。
translation: Now, I'll entrust this sūtra with making sure that not a single word is missing and that the taste body, phrase body, and body are complete.

source_sentence: 皆令具足。
translation: All of them will be made complete.

source_sentence: 如我今日成於佛道，相有三十二，好有八十種，身黃金色圓光七尺，遍滿三千大千世界。
translation: 'Today, I'll become a buddha with thirty-two features and eighty kinds of beauty, and my body will have a yellow-golden, circular light seven feet in length that will fill 3,000 great thousand worlds.'

source_sentence: 有一善男子善女人，至誠求佛道，供養如來、至真、等正覺，不如彈指之頃誦此經典。
translation: If there's a good man or good woman who sincerely seeks the Buddha's path and makes offerings to the Tathāgata, the Supreme Truth, and the Completely Awakened One, he or she couldn't snap their fingers and recite this sūtra in an instant.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 如來、至真、等正覺，皆由此經而成佛道，須陀洹、斯陀含、阿那含、阿羅漢、辟支佛，皆由此典而得成就。」
translation: 如來、至真、等正覺，皆由此經而成佛道，須陀洹、斯陀含、阿那含、阿羅漢、辟支佛，皆由此典而得成就。」

source_sentence: 爾時無畏梵天前白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the fearless Brahmā gods went before the Buddha and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若有善男子善女人，至誠求佛，諷誦此經典戢念不忘，我等當擁護此善男子善女人，百由旬內，魔若魔天不得其便。」
translation: If there are good men and good women who sincerely seek the Buddha, recite this sūtra, and memorize it, we will support these good men and good women for a hundred leagues, and Māra and Māra Devānām-Indra won't be able to get an advantage over them."

source_sentence: 佛告梵天：「如是如是，如汝所言。
translation: The Buddha told the Brahmā gods, "So it is, just as you say.

source_sentence: 過去當來現在諸佛皆誦此典，必至堅固終不退轉。
translation: All the buddhas of the past, future, and present recite this scripture, and it will become resolute and never turn away.

source_sentence: 若有善男子善女人，修習四意止、四意斷、四神足、五根、五力、七覺意、八賢聖道、空無想無願，皆由此典成就世間，便有四性，比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷。」
translation: If there are good sons and good women who cultivate the four mental states of calmness, the four mental states of elimination, the four spiritual abilities, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven awakened thoughts, the eight noble paths, and emptiness, without ideation or wish, and they all attain worldly attainment from this scripture, then they'll have the four natures of monks, bhikṣus and nuns, upāsaka and upāsikā."

source_sentence: 爾時濡首童真、最勝菩薩、尊者舍利弗，天、龍、鬼神、乾沓和、阿須倫、迦留羅、栴陀羅、摩休勒，聞佛所說，作禮而去。
translation: It was then that Mañjuśrī, Most Excellent Bodhisattva, Venerable Śāriputra, gods, dragons, spirits, Gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, caṇḍalas, and mahoras, hearing what the Buddha taught, paid homage and departed.

translation: Shizhu duanjie jing, vol. 10
